Key:
I see. Karaoke, huh? Didn't expect this.
You like karaoke, Maria?

I also wished to try singing together with
you, Shido.
(Hm? What does she mean by also"? Does
Now then, Shido. Let us try singing.
Right. Um...
(Maria wasn't browsing though the songlist...)

Maria, just to confirm, you know what to do
at karaoke, right?

Of course. You choose a song with this small
device. When it travels to the main device,
your selection will play.

Oh, so you do know. Then, if you have a song
in mind, you're free to input it.

I have records of songs you've sung previously
with your friends, but choosing one myself
is rather difficult.

Songs I've sung previously? But this is our
first time together at karaoke, isn't it, Maria?

Ah... Um, yes. Um...
I meant from past data.
Ohh, I see.

(Now that she mentions it, we are inside
of a game created by Ratatoskr. Guess it's
not weird that she'd know that.)
So, what next?

May I... leave it to you? I request a song
that a regular girl would sing.

Um, how about... This new one? Or maybe
a famous pop song.

Would it be okay for you to choose the
specific song?
I see. Then, I'll pick a good one.

(Not that I'm knowledgeable of what songs
are good. I'll flip through the catalogue.)
Pick a mellow ballad.
Pick a cheery pop song.
For now, how's this?

Light of the Snow, is it? This title...
I see. A slow tempo ballad, yes?

Right. It's a slow song, so I thought it might
be easier to sing.

There is no problem. I have heard this song
before.
But, um, is it a problem for you, Shido?
What do you mean? I don't have any problem...

I see. If you have no problem, then neither
do I.

I don't really understand, but if you're ready,
let's play this song. Okay, I'll press it.

(After I made the selection, the intro began
playing immediately.)
Then Shido, for a brief moment, pardon me.
Huh? Wha, Maria...?!
Could it be that I am too heavy?

No. You're not heavy at all. I'm just surprised.
But, what's wrong, Maria?

This is a love song, so I thought this to be
appropriate. When couples sing, my records
indicate it is best to sit very close together.

Err. Well, Maria... That's what regular couples
do, and...
Could it be, Shido, that you do not like this?
No, I don't mind. I don't mind at all.

I see. How very reassuring. Oh, the song is
about to begin.

(Was I pushed into this situation? Maria doesn't
seem to be giving much into her singing, but I
can't tell from the side of her face.)

Um, I am not accustomed to singing, so was
I singing out of key?
No, not at all.

(Surprisingly, though she's not had much
experience, she sings quite well. Though I
think she could've used more spirit.)

(But it wasn't like she was emotionless.
Each word shot through my heart, just from
me sitting next to her.)
Next is your turn, Shido.
R-Right!

Whew, it's finally over. It felt both brief
and like an eternity, all at once.

You were quite enthusiastic. You seemed to
sweat a bit. Are you all right?
Yeah, it's nothing! Really!
I hope that is the case.

Then, I think a pop song is the best choice.
The words are easy to understand, making
them easy to sing.

(Looking at the title of the song I chose,
Maria nodded in agreement.)
It is fine. I believe I can sing this song.

Okay. I'll put in a couple similar ones too,
so think of it as practice.
(Then, the intro began to play...)
Whew...

(We sang a few songs, but Maria doesn't
seem satisfied. Her expression hasn't changed
in a while.)
Hey, Maria. Are you not having fun?
No, that is incorrect. This is very fun.

Is it? You've had this troubled look on your
face for a while now.
To be honest, I was deep in thought.

Hm, I figured. If you'd like, we can talk
about it?

Our conversation would pertain to what I am
thinking... yes?

Yeah. We're on a date after all. I want you to
have fun if at all possible, Maria. If something
is bothering you, it'd help if you told me.

...I understand. Shido, would this be called a
date?
Huh? It is a date... I think.

Factually, it is. But to me, it does not quite
feel like a date.

Hm. I don't think you need to worry too much
about that, you know? If you just let loose,
then...

No. I was wondering if the reason it does
not feel like a date lies with me. I kept on
asking myself... why that might be.
But karaoke was fun, wasn't it?
Yes. Very much so.

Then focus on that. Instead of worrying about
stuff, it's better to sit back and enjoy the
moment.
I see... Okay.

(It seems like Maria isn't fully convinced.
If it bothers her, I should probably do
something about it.)
We could do something like a couple...
Shido, I have a suggestion... Is that all right?
Yeah. Let's hear it.

What if we held hands while we sing? If we
did that, it could feel more like a date... As if
we were a couple?
Got it. Let's try.

Yes. My records indicate that, when holding
hands while singing, you can pull your
partner's heart closer to you... so they say.

Th-That seems a little specific, but I don't
know if that's true or not...
You do, Shido.
...I do? You seem pretty certain, huh?
Yes. There should be no mistake.
Well, if you insist, Maria... Let's try it.
Yes. Let us do so, Shido.
(For now, I requested another song.)
Um, so I should hold your hand, right?
Er, ah...!
Hm, Maria?

I apologize. It was so sudden, I surprised
myself. Um. If the song has begun, I am ready.
I-I see. Sorry for touching you so suddenly.
No. It is fine.

Oh, there's the title. It's going to connect.
Are you ready?
Yes... Please go ahead.

(Maria's hand was gentle and soft. It was
also kinda warm. Might be my imagination,
but her face seems more flushed than before.)
Um, Shido... You keep looking at me, why?
Ack! S-Sorry!

(Maria's outfit was pretty, so I couldn't help
from sneaking a peek.)

(It's true. I shouldn't be ogling a girl...
Concentrate, concentrate on the song...)
It is over.
Yeah, how was it?

Like your warmth has transferred to me, Shido.
I believe this was a couple-like activity.

If you're satisfied, Maria, then I'm glad.
Should we keep going to the next song?
Er, well...

Er, ah. I guess not. Time's almost up, so let's
head home. I'll gather our belongin—
That is no good, either.
Huh? Um, Maria?

(What am I supposed to do in situations
like these? Let go of her hand? Or should
I keep holding onto it?)
Would you... like to go home like this?
Like this?

While still holding hands, I mean. Let us
continue our couple-like date until the end.
Right... You're right.

(Maria's smile was sunny, and I answered
hastily, trying to repress how quickly my
heart was beating.)

Today was enjoyable. Going shopping with the
group, eating sweets, and going to karaoke
with you, Shido...
These are truly memories to cherish.
I see. Glad to hear it.

I dearly enjoy spending time with you and
everyone else. I have been tending to this
thought often.
I'm happy for you, Maria.
You are?

People naturally want to spend time with
others. I think it means you're getting closer
to love, Maria.

I am getting closer to love. Is this because
I have changed?
You are surely the person who brought\ncolor to my world.
Huh, Maria?! That's...

A line from the song we sang. I am beginning
to change now, thanks to you and the others.
I sincerely believe it.
Nice. If you think so Maria, then it's true.
Yes.
